curated_text: Symbol: FIS. Year: 2024. Period: Q2. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: FIS, Worldpay, IPO, ELA, Company, TSA, the Worldpay Sale, RealNet, Virtus Partners, Virtus, Banking to Corporate, Capital Banking Market Corporate Solutions Solutions, 544 Total, Software, Professional, Contract Balances The Company, the Remaining Performance Obligations As, Consolidated Financial Statement Details Cash, Property and Equipment, Property, Net Intangible, Capital Corporate Banking Market And Solutions Solutions Other Total Balance, Banking and, Capital Markets, Equity Security Investments The Company, Taxes, Weighted Average Interest Interest, Rates Rate, the Revolving Credit Facility, Secured Overnight Financing Rate, Rate Maturities, Unaudited, the Revolving Credit Facility's, USCP, ECP, Revolving Credit Facility, Fair Value of Debt, the Senior GBP Notes, AOCI, Net Investment Hedges, Euro-, Pound Sterling, Euro, Unaudited) Cross-Currency Interest Rate Swap Designations, Contingencies Securities, Fidelity National Information Services, Inc. Securities Litigation, Inc., Georgia Code §, City of Southfield Fire and Police Retirement System, the "Southfield Demand, Board, Demand Review Committee, McCollum, Hialeah Demands, The Demand Review Committee, City of Hialeah Employees' Retirement System, the Individual Defendants, Fidelity National Servicos de Tratamento de Documentos, Fidelity National Participacoes Ltda, the Transpev Group, Transpev/Prosegur, Board of Directors, Segment Information, Capital Market Solutions, Corporate, Future Forward, FASB ASC Topic, Indirect Worldpay, Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, Fidelity National Information Services, Inc., Consolidated Financial Statements, COVID-19. Context excerpt: competition covenants, distribution mechanics, preemptive rights and follow-on equity funding commitments of the Buyer, and restrictions on transfer and associated tag-along and drag-along rights. Each of FIS and the Buyer will have the right to require Worldpay to consummate an initial public offering ("IPO") or sale transaction after the fourth anniversary of the closing, subject to certain return hurdles 12 Table of Contents FIDELITY NATIONAL INFORMATION SERVICES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Unaudited) and (in the case of an IPO) public float requirements, which requirements will fall away following the sixth anniversary of the closing. We have continuing involvement with Worldpay, primarily through our remaining interest, an employee leasing agreement ("ELA"), a transition services agreement ("TSA"), and various other commercial agreements.
